Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the Panel's decision regarding the availability of state protection in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is reasonable
Application_Facts: The applicant claimed refugee status due to past sexual abuse and lack of state protection; she lacks family support and has a history of abuse
Decision_Outcome: The Panel's decision was found unreasonable
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Panel's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of harm, inability to access state protection, past sexual abuse, lack of familial support
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Assessment_Factor: Availability and effectiveness of state protection in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
Applicable_Legislation: Subparagraph 97(1)(b)(i) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under sections 72 and following of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Used: Evidence of past abuse, lack of family support, conditions in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
Application_Basis: Inability or unwillingness to avail oneself of protection of the country of nationality due to risk
Evidence_Assessed: Panel selectively used evidence and ignored negative aspects of state protection
Governing_Rule: A person is in need of protection if they cannot access their countryâ€™s protection due to risk
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider applicant's unique circumstances and selective use of evidence
Outcome: Panel's decision overturned; case remanded for fresh determination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of further abuse due to lack of state protection and personal vulnerability
Cause_Description: Past sexual abuse and lack of effective state protection in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
Evidence_Handling: Incomplete and biased consideration of evidence by the Panel
Legal_Provision_Violated: Subparagraph 97(1)(b)(i) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Ignored relevant evidence on state protection failures and individual circumstances
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 97(1)(b)(i)
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient and unreasonable assessment of available evidence
Decision_Rationale: Decision was unreasonable due to incomplete analysis and failure to consider key factors
Evidentiary_Issues: Selective reliance on evidence, omission of negative indicators, disregard of personal vulnerabilities
